summary: "Pride and Prejudice," written by Jane Austen in 1813, is a story about Elizabeth Bennet, who learns not to judge people too quickly. The book follows her growth as she distinguishes between what seems good and what truly is. Set in Hertfordshire, the Bennet family faces poverty as their estate can only be passed to a man. So, it's crucial for the daughters to marry well. Despite challenges, this novel has become one of the most beloved books in English literature, with over 20 million copies sold and countless adaptations in film, TV, and other books.
title: Pride and Prejudice
